poem.content:
The sheriff sleeps, while dawn begins to spread,
A frost of pixels on the nascent wave.
The size and shape of fortunes lie ahead,
A dynamic market, fortunes to engrave.

Some seek the wealth, a glittering, high desire,
Others, a valid claim, a just reward.
But fate can differ, burning like a fire,
And crush the dream, upon its ledger broad.

The feature blooms, a vibrant digital flower,
Inviting all to join the grand display.
A mutual dance, where power meets its hour,
Before the code decides another way.

A mix of hope and fear, a chilling trace,
Through veins of light, a silent algorithm's pace.
The sheriff wakes, his judgment to impart,
To mend the broken, reunite the heart.
Now wave good bye, to wealth beyond compare.
The frost descends, this burden we will bare.
